title: Graphical Analysis with Geo Series and Arc Length

content.question: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. The graph of the function <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="negative 5 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> consists of a quarter circle and four line segments, as shown in the figure above. Let <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="h of x equals, the integral from negative 2 to x, of, g of t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="negative 5 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Find the value of <math alttext="h prime of 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> or explain why it does not exist.

frqParts.text: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. The graph of the function <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="negative 5 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> consists of a quarter circle and four line segments, as shown in the figure above. Let <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="h of x equals, the integral from negative 2 to x, of, g of t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="negative 5 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Find the value of <math alttext="h prime of 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> or explain why it does not exist.

(b) At what value of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> does <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> attain its minimum value on the interval <math alttext="negative 5 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Justify your answer.

(c) Find the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-coordinate of all points of inflection of the graph of <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="negative 5 less than x, less than 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Justify your answer.

(d) Let <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="k of x equals, open parenthesis, g of x, close parenthesis, cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find the value of <math alttext="k prime of 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(e) Find <math alttext="the limit as x approaches negative 2, of, the fraction with numerator h of x, and denominator 3 x plus 6, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. Give a reason for your answer.
(f) Find the value of <math alttext="h of 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(g) For what value of <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> does the series <math alttext="30 r, plus 30 times r squared, plus dot dot dot, plus 30 times r to the n power, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mi>r</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>30</mn><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>30</mn><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> equal the value of <math alttext="h of 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> found in part (f)? Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(h) Does the Mean Value Theorem guarantee a value of <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="negative 5 less than c, less than 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>c</mi><mo><</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, such that <math alttext="h double prime of c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is equal to the average rate of change of <math alttext="h prime" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> over the interval <math alttext="negative 5 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Why or why not?

(i) What is the value of <math alttext="the integral from negative 5 to negative 2, of, the square root of, 1 plus, open parenthesis, g prime of x, close parenthesis, squared, end root, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> ? Give a reason for your answer.

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
